description: It is a one-off holiday in the German capital, but some think it should be marked nationally each year.
title: VE Day: Berlin marks end of WW2 in Europe with unprecedented holiday
title_page: VE Day: Berlin marks end of WW2 in Europe with unprecedented holiday - BBC News
maintext: For some, particularly in areas of the old West Germany, 8 May has long been associated with defeat in World War Two. Many families preferred to draw a veil over the period, both those who had suffered persecution as well as those who hadn't.
